tool_description: You can use Detect Dominant Language to examine text to determine the dominant language. DDL identifies the language using identifiers from RFC 5646 — if there is a 2-letter ISO 639-1 identifier, with a regional subtag if necessary, it uses that. Otherwise, it uses the ISO 639-2 3-letter code.
name: Detect Dominant Language
title: Detect Dominant Language

api_list.name: analyze
api_list.description:
Post data to analyze.

Args:
    request: Request from HTTP connection.
    block_data: Incoming data.

Returns:
    Response in JSON format.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://detect-dominant-language1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "detect-dominant-language1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
